metadata.Name: Japanese Web Corpus
metadata.Description: A large-scale Japanese web corpus created from 21 Common Crawl snapshots (crawled between 2020 and 2023). The corpus consists of approximately 312.1 billion characters from 173 million pages. It was built using a specialized filtering and deduplication pipeline, including rules specific to Japanese text, to ensure high quality for pre-training large language models.
metadata.Paper Title: Building a Large Japanese Web Corpus for Large Language Models
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2024 Conference on Language Modeling
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, School of Computing, Tokyo Institute of Technology
Global Scientific Information and Computing Center, Tokyo Institute of Technology
metadata.Abstract: Open Japanese large language models (LLMs) have been trained on the Japanese portions of corpora such as CC-100, mC4, and OSCAR. However, these corpora were not created for the quality of Japanese texts. This study builds a large Japanese web corpus by extracting and refining text from the Common Crawl archive (21 snapshots of approximately 63.4 billion pages crawled between 2020 and 2023). This corpus consists of approximately 312.1 billion characters (approximately 173 million pages), which is the largest of all available training corpora for Japanese LLMs, surpassing CC-100 (approximately 25.8 billion characters), mC4 (approximately 239.7 billion characters) and OSCAR 23.10 (approximately 74 billion characters). To confirm the quality of the corpus, we performed continual pre-training on Llama 2 7B, 13B, 70B, Mistral 7B v0.1, and Mixtral 8x7B Instruct as base LLMs and gained consistent (6.6--8.1 points) improvements on Japanese benchmark datasets. We also demonstrate that the improvement on Llama 2 13B brought from the presented corpus was the largest among those from other existing corpora.
